Summary: Star like object moving at high speed across the night sky
divs: Sighting DetailsMy friend and I were going on a motorcycle ride. I pull up to my friends house and look. I saw a very bright star that resembled the brightness of Venus. I was facing east south east. It continued on a north, north west trajectory. It was covering a huge portion of night sky very quickly. The speed was like nothing I have ever seen before. I know something at the altitude cannot cover a whole hemisphere of night sky that quckickly unless it's a meteror comet or a hypersonic aircraft. As passed above my head it slowed down buy was still moving very quickly. A cloud was in the northern part of the sky. It passed behind the cloud and never cane out the othe side. If I had to guesstimate the speed I would assume at that altitiude the craft must of been traveling at least Mach 6 or 7. But I have never seen a craft move that fast so have no basis for comparison. I was thought it was just a meteor at first but when I saw slow down and doses ear behind a cloud I knew what it was. Also I thought it might of been a firework but the altitude of this object was far beyond even commercial fireworks in altitude. It really was that altitude the got my attention. A craft That resembles a star. Must be high up. I 20 miles away from ohare international airport. I have seen a lot of high moving jets. I have never mistook a jet for a star. For it to be that high, bright, and moving at that speed was nothing short of amazing.
